business.headline: Budget without populism and with capital outlays powers growth, jobs: PMDescribing the Budget for the fiscal year starting April 1 as reflective of his governance approach, PM Modi said the document is a good reflection of our governance style and priorities.

Have Rs 5,000? Here's why an emergency fund should come before your SIPYou've heard the advice, i.e., "Start a SIP immediately." But is that the smartest first move with Rs 5,000? The choice might surprise you.

Will AI change how you invest your money in stocks and mutual funds?The next market shift may not come from earnings or interest rates. It may come from AI. In this article, we explore how it could reshape your stock and mutual fund investments.

Air India fined Rs 1 crore for flying Airbus 8 times without airworthiness permitThe DGCA has imposed a fine of about Rs 1 crore on Air India for flying an Airbus aircraft eight times without a valid airworthiness permit. The aviation watchdog also said the lapse further eroded public trust in the airline.

Why personalised loans are becoming the go-to option in 2026The journey of hyper-personalisation in personal loans is going to get more exciting for customers with the increasing adoption of technology refining customer offerings, based on minute details of the customers.

RBI plans to update Kisan Credit Card rules : 5 key changes to trackThe Reserve Bank of India is preparing to overhaul the Kisan Credit Card scheme, and the proposed changes could reshape how farmers borrow and repay loans. With the new draft rules on the table, what exactly is set to change for farm credit?

Sensex crashes over 1,000 points: What's behind today's market bloodbath?The market opened on a weak note and remained under pressure throughout the session, with losses deepening in the second half. The decline appeared to be driven by profit booking at elevated levels and a cautious mood among investors amid global uncertainties.

Reliance wins US licence for Venezuelan oil as India wavers on Russia supplyReliance applied for the licence in early January as India looks to diversify its energy purchases. Direct purchase of Venezuelan oil will help Reliance replace Russian oil in a cost-effective way.

Cheque bounced? How one mistake can spiral into legal and financial troubleA bounced cheque may seem like a minor slip, but it can quickly trigger penalties, credit damage and even legal complications. What starts as a simple payment error can snowball into a serious financial setback. Are you aware of the risks?

8th Pay Commission: Government seeks public feedback; who can participateThe recommendations of the 8th Pay Commission are expected to influence future salary structures, allowances and pension benefits for central government staff.

Gold, silver prices rise slightly: Rise ahead or fall on the cards?After days of volatility, gold and silver have posted modest gains, catching the attention of investors. The small rise has reopened a familiar debate, i.e., are precious metals preparing for another climb, or is a fresh dip still possible?

RBI steps in to stop mis-selling by banks: Decoding what's good and what's not clearThe Reserve Bank of India has signalled its intent after years of rising mis-selling complaints. But will this draft protect ordinary customers before the next grievance is filed? In this article, we break down what changes, what remains unclear, and whether enforcement can finally make a difference.

65-10-10-15 rule: How a 4-asset 'boring thali' portfolio helps in uncertain marketsWhen markets feel uncertain and investors struggle to decide where to put their money, a simple multi-asset strategy is drawing attention. Instead of chasing trends, the 65-10-10-15 "boring thali" approach focusses on balance and steady investing.

Is it the end of the road for silver after a spectacular rally?After a stunning rally and an equally sharp fall, silver now sits at a crucial crossroads, leaving investors wondering whether this correction is nearing its end or still gathering momentum.

Sensex crashes over 1,000 points: Why is the stock market falling today?At 3:16 pm, the Sensex was down 1055.91 points to 82,619.01, while the Nifty stood at 25,481.35, lower by 325.85 points. The fall was led by heavy selling in IT stocks, but the triggers lie largely in global developments.

TCS, Infosys sink nearly 6%: 3 reasons why IT stocks are falling againShares of TCS and Infosys fell nearly 6% in early trade, dragging the Nifty IT index lower. The weakness was not driven by any one company-specific announcement. Instead, it reflects a mix of global triggers and rising uncertainty around how artificial intelligence will reshape the industry.

Sensex drops 700 points as AI panic hits IT stocks; Infosys, TCS drop 5%The Sensex fell over 700 points in early trade, while the Nifty slipped below the 25,600 mark. The decline was led by frontline technology majors such as Infosys and TCS, along with other large-cap IT names.

Retail inflation at 2.75% in January as India shifts to new CPI base year 2024The data, released by the Ministry of Statistics and Programme Implementation, reflects a major statistical overhaul aimed at making India's inflation measure more representative of current consumption patterns.

A 90-year-old man was sold a 100-year policy. Why blaming the bank is not enoughHandcrafted ByOur Editors A 90-year-old man was sold an insurance policy maturing in 2124. The case sounds bizarre. But instances of mis-selling like this are painfully common across the country. The bank resolved the matter after a viral social media post. The harder question is why blaming the bank alone is not enough.

Sensex sinks over 500 points, Nifty tumbles as AI panic sinks IT stocksThe benchmark BSE Sensex fell 559 points to close at 85,674.92, while the Nifty 50 slipped below the psychologically important 25,900 mark.

entertainment.headline: Hrithik Roshan reacts to Mumbai pillar collapse, seeks strict action Actor Hrithik Roshan reacts to the fatal Mumbai Metro pillar collapse in Mulund, calling it "traumatic" and urging stricter safety measures. Here's what happened.

Malayalam actor Shiva Hariharan calls 42-rule claim against Allu Arjun a myth Allu Arjun's team refutes claims of strict behavioural protocols, initiates legal action, and receives support from fellow actor Shiva Hariharan following social media criticism.

Anoushka Shankar says Pandit Ravi Shankar was never Rishabh Rikhiram's guru Anoushka Shankar clarified that Rishabh Rikhiram was not Ravi Shankar's last disciple. Here's what she said about the long-standing claim.

Boxer Vijender Singh offers Rajpal Yadav film role, says he respects true talent Boxer Vijender Singh offered Rajpal Yadav a role in his next film as the actor serves time in Tihar Jail over a Rs 9 crore debt case. Here's what happened.

Mahesh Babu launches Nagabandham teaser; Film promises mix of myth and history Actor Mahesh Babu unveils the Nagabandham teaser on Maha Shivaratri, offering a glimpse of a mythological-historical epic led by Virat Karrna. Here's what makes it intriguing.

Anil Kapoor says political parties approached him after Nayak. See why he declined Actor Anil Kapoor reveals political parties approached him after Nayak and even the UN made offers post Slumdog Millionaire. Here's why he chose to walk away.

The problem starts from home: Taapsee Pannu on India's rape crisis Actor Taapsee Pannu calls for deeper reflection on rising rape cases in India, saying the problem "starts from home". Here's what she said and how it connects to her upcoming film Assi.

Royal Albert Hall confuses Vir Das for Aziz Ansari, comic reacts A mix-up on the Royal Albert Hall website led to Vir Das's photo being shown for Aziz Ansari's upcoming show, prompting humorous reactions from both comedians and their fans.

Sanjay Leela Bhansali unveils Jai Somnath, locks 2027 worldwide release Filmmaker Sanjay Leela Bhansali announces Jai Somnath for a 2027 worldwide release. Directed by Ketan Mehta, the historical epic promises scale, faith and cinematic grandeur.

Priyadarshan hikes Rajpal Yadav's fees in upcoming project amid debt case Members of the film community, including Priyadarshan and Gurmeet Choudhary, have come forward to support Rajpal Yadav, who remains in legal custody over an alleged Rs 9 crore debt linked to his 2012 film. Despite efforts to assist him, his bail request was rejected.

AR Rahman's Chennai comeback gets a surprise twist from Dhanush. Watch videos Oscar-winning composer AR Rahman returned to Chennai in style, treating fans to a sweeping journey through his timeless classics and newer hits. The evening turned even more special with a surprise on-stage appearance by Dhanush.

Abhishek Bachchan cautions actors on unchecked use of AI, says it scares him At the ET NOW Global Business Summit 2026, Abhishek Bachchan expresses his worries about the rapid rise of artificial intelligence, highlighting its potential risks for actors and wider disruption across sectors.

Ranbir Kapoor crowns Dhurandhar his top pick at the movies: Cast, crew smashed it Ranbir Kapoor recently revealed his admiration for the spy thriller Dhurandhar, starring Ranveer Singh, calling it his favourite film. The movie has gained wide recognition and its sequel is set for release next month.

Was Nagarjuna first choice for Akshaye Khanna's role in Dhurandhar? Actor responds Nagarjuna addressed rumours about being offered the role of Rehman Dakait in Aditya Dhar's Dhurandhar. He also praised the film and Akshaye Khanna, and shared updates on his upcoming projects.

O Romeo box office Day 2: Valentine's weekend boosts collections for Shahid's drama Shahid Kapoor and Triptii Dimri's new film O Romeo saw a significant increase in box office collections on its second day, marking a promising start despite performing below the actor's previous hits.

Sunny, Rajini, Chiru and company: Life's rocking after 65 for the retro superstars When it comes to defying age and being the limelight moth, Sunny Deol in Border 2, Chiranjeevi in Mana Shankara Vara Prasad Garu and Rajinikanth in Jailer have shown how it's done

Tu Yaa Main box office Day 2: Bejoy Nambiar's survival drama sees slow growth Bejoy Nambiar's film Tu Yaa Main, starring Adarsh Gourav and Shanaya Kapoor, collected just 2 crore over its first two days, with limited occupancy and slow box office performance across India.

Jana Nayagan won't release before April 30, Canada distributor says International distributor, York Cinemas, confirmed that Vijay's final film Jana Nayagan is delayed until after April 30, 2026, as fans await further updates and the re-release of Theri is scheduled for February.

Assi review: Not easy. Not optional. Like the truth we avoid about women's safetyRelease Date:Fri Feb 20, 2026 Anubhav Sinha's Assi is not an easy watch, and it isn't meant to be. The film confronts sexual violence, patriarchy and the justice system without offering comfort. If you think cinema should do more than entertain, this is a conversation you cannot ignore.

general news.headline: PM pushes for defence modernisation, says must match current realitiesBudget 2026 saw a massive increase in defence spending, raising the overall defence budget to Rs 7.85 lakh crore for the current financial year, up from Rs 6.81 lakh crore in the previous year – a hike of nearly 15%.

Formats, places change, but result same: Politicians praise Team India win vs PakPolitical leaders on Sunday praised India's emphatic win over Pakistan in the T20 World Cup. Union Home Minister Amit Shah said formats, places, and dates may change, but the result of India vs Pakistan remains consistent.
Samajwadi Party leader killed as high mast pole falls on moving car in UPThe Samajwadi Party leader was barely 500 metres from his home when a high mast pole collapsed onto his moving car.

Do aliens exist? Barack Obama says yes but rules out hidden Area 51 conspiracyFormer US president Barack Obama said in a recent podcast interview that aliens are real but added that he has not personally seen any. He made the remark when asked directly about the existence of extraterrestrial life.

Watch: Irfan Pathan dances to 'Afghan Jalebi' to troll Pakistan after India's winFormer India all-rounder Irfan Pathan trolled Pakistan by sharing a video of himself dancing to the popular track 'Afghan Jalebi' after India's comprehensive 61-run win in the Group A clash in Colombo.

Om Birla to represent India at Bangladesh PM-elect Tarique Rahman's swearing-inThe government said Om Birla's participation in the ceremony underlines the importance New Delhi attaches to its relationship with Dhaka.

Ghaziabad woman, 23, dies by suicide, family alleges Rs 30-lakh scam by friendsThe woman's family claimed that her childhood friend conspired with three other people and scammed her of around Rs 30 lakh.

Big hawala racket busted in J&K, 8,000 accounts with anti-India activities frozenInvestigators describe mule accounts as the most vulnerable yet indispensable component in the cybercrime pipeline. Without them, criminals would struggle to channel stolen funds into untraceable digital assets such as cryptocurrency.

Haryana family welcomes Dutch woman biker with open arms after she asks to campA solo woman traveller from the Netherlands was offered shelter and hospitality by a local family in Haryana after seeking a place to camp.

The dream job that doesn't pay the rent: India's IT salary realityFor years, a Big Tech job in India has been sold as the ultimate middle-class dream, but for many freshers in 2026, the reality begins with a salary package that hasn't kept pace with inflation, rent, or real life. This is the story of brand-name jobs, stagnant starter pay, and a generation quietly realising that their "dream offer" comes with a 2013 pay cheque.

Watch: Pak Army chief Asim Munir nearly stopped for ID check at Munich summitAt the Munich Security Conference, Pakistan Army Chief Field Marshal Asim Munir was briefly stopped by security over his ID badge, highlighting the strict protocols at global forums. This moment quickly went viral, drawing attention amidst protests against his participation.

Rain or heat? Here's what the new Western Disturbance brings on MondayA new western disturbance will reach India on February 16, bringing clouds to the Himalayas. Expert Devendra Tripathi explains why temperatures are rising in the plains.

Heartbroken Pakistan fan smashes TV after humbling loss to India in ColomboT20 World Cup, IND vs PAK: A heartbroken Pakistan supporter was filmed smashing his television set following the team's crushing 61-run defeat to India in Colombo. He was just one of millions left reeling after Sunday's humbling at the hands of their arch-rivals.

Time's up for Babar, Shaheen: Ex-captain slams Pakistan stars after India lossFormer Pakistan captain Mohammad Yousuf has launched a scathing attack on the team's senior core after Pakistan's crushing 61-run defeat to India in the ICC T20 World Cup 2026 in Colombo, declaring that it is "time's up" for Babar Azam, Shaheen Shah Afridi and Shadab Khan.

Mani Shankar Aiyar says Pinarayi Vijayan will be Kerala CM again. Congress reactsThe veteran Congress leader's comments came at a time when his party is leaving no stone unturned to come back to power.

7 dead as high-speed SUV rams bike, overturns, triggers chain crash near BengaluruAn SUV rammed a bike before crashing into the divider and overturning, killing seven in an early morning vehicle pile-up near Bengaluru.

How this 12-year-old boy built a nuclear fusion reactor in his roomAiden McMillan, a 12-year-old from Dallas, has successfully produced nuclear fusion in his playroom. He spent four years on the project.

Through the smog, Delhi is looking up at the birds againHandcrafted ByOur Editors Delhi's reputation indeed makes you sceptical about going out and being in nature, but the turnout on these walks tells another story.  And birdwatching is actually what's trending in the capital.

The problem starts from home: Taapsee Pannu on India's rape crisisActor Taapsee Pannu calls for deeper reflection on rising rape cases in India, saying the problem "starts from home". Here's what she said and how it connects to her upcoming film Assi.

Missing Indian Berkeley student found dead in California after 6 daysSaketh Sreenivasaiah, the 22-year-old University of California student who had been missing since February 9, has been confirmed dead in the US.

Anoushka Shankar says Pandit Ravi Shankar was never Rishabh Rikhiram's guruAnoushka Shankar clarified that Rishabh Rikhiram was not Ravi Shankar's last disciple. Here's what she said about the long-standing claim.

The intelligence war is now happening in space. Indian spies are readyThe newest frontier for surveillance and intelligence is now space, as satellites crisscross the skies, not just watching below but also around in the blackness of space.

Bengaluru bank employee steals 2.7 kg of gold from locker to fund gamblingThe theft surfaced on January 2, when customers visited the Indian Bank branch to retrieve their pledged jewellery. During locker verification, discrepancies emerged, prompting a detailed inspection.

Suryakumar Yadav avoids shaking hands with Pakistan captain at tossICC T20 World Cup, India vs Pakistan: India captain Suryakumar Yadav and Pakistan skipper Salman Ali Agha did not shake hands during the toss of their T20 World Cup 2026 clash in Colombo on Sunday, as India continued its no-handshake policy against Pakistan.

sports.headline: Matchday Preview: Struggling Australia look to breathe life into their campaign T20 World Cup: Day 10 of the tournament features crucial clashes in Delhi, Kolkata and Pallekele as Afghanistan face UAE, England meet Italy and Australia take on Sri Lanka in matches that could shape the Super 8 race.

IND vs PAK: Axar Patel focused on being a team man, not stressed about changing roles Here is the full transcript of India all-rounder Axar Patel's press conference after their 61-run loss to India in the Group A clash in the ICC Men's T20 World Cup in Colombo.

Pakistan no match for India in skill and temperament: Sunil Gavaskar T20 World Cup 2026: Speaking to India Today after India's 61-run victory in Colombo, legendary Sunil Gavaskar highlighted the gulf in skill and temperament between the two sides. He also heaped praise on Ishan Kishan for his superb 77 off 40 balls, noting that the innings effectively took the game away from Pakistan on Sunday.

Fearless Ishan Kishan took the game away from Pakistan: Pak coach Mike Hesson India vs Pakistan, ICC T20 World Cup: Pakistan head coach Mike Hesson said it was Ishan Kishan's counter-attacking knock, rather than the top-order collapse, that proved to be the difference between the two sides in Pakistan's 61-run defeat to India in Colombo.

Heartbroken Pakistan fan smashes TV after humbling loss to India in Colombo T20 World Cup, IND vs PAK: A heartbroken Pakistan supporter was filmed smashing his television set following the team's crushing 61-run defeat to India in Colombo. He was just one of millions left reeling after Sunday's humbling at the hands of their arch-rivals.

Time's up for Babar, Shaheen: Ex-captain slams Pakistan stars after India loss Former Pakistan captain Mohammad Yousuf has launched a scathing attack on the team's senior core after Pakistan's crushing 61-run defeat to India in the ICC T20 World Cup 2026 in Colombo, declaring that it is "time's up" for Babar Azam, Shaheen Shah Afridi and Shadab Khan.

This is for India: Surya after crushing Pakistan in T20 World Cup 2026 IND vs PAK, T20 World Cup: Suryakumar Yadav dedicated their 61-run win over Pakistan to his nation, India. Ishan Kishan's 77 and Jasprit Bumrah's brilliance powered India to the Super Eight stage in Colombo on Sunday.

Why was Usman Tariq held back against India? Coach clarifies surprise move T20 World Cup, IND vs PAK: Pakistan coach Mike Hesson explained why Usman Tariq was held back during the match against India. On Sunday, Pakistan suffered a 61-run defeat, with Tariq returning figures of 4-0-24-1.

Watch: Irfan Pathan dances to 'Afghan Jalebi' to troll Pakistan after India's win Former India all-rounder Irfan Pathan trolled Pakistan by sharing a video of himself dancing to the popular track 'Afghan Jalebi' after India's comprehensive 61-run win in the Group A clash in Colombo.

Pakistan in danger of early T20 World Cup exit. Can it really happen? T20 World Cup, IND vs PAK: Salman Agha's Pakistan are in danger of an early exit from the tournament following their 61-run defeat to Suryakumar Yadav's India on Sunday at the R Premadasa Stadium in Colombo.

No surprise: India steamroll predictably poor Pakistan to march into Super 8s IND vs PAK, T20 World Cup 2026: India hammered a predictably poor Pakistan by 61 runs to storm into the Super 8s stage. Handing Pakistan their biggest defeat in T20i head-to-head, India aced the battle of spin in Colombo on Sunday, February 15.

Babar Azam's nightmare vs India continues after yet another failure in T20 World CupT20 World Cup, IND vs PAK: Babar Azam scored five runs off seven balls before Axar Patel accounted for his wicket in the Group A clash on Sunday at the R Premadasa Stadium in Colombo

Usman Tariq outfoxes Suryakumar Yadav, gives India captain cheeky send-offIndia vs Pakistan, T20 World Cup 2026: Pakistan's Usman Tariq delivered a cheeky send-off to India's captain, Suryakumar Yadav following the latter's dismissal.

India's 12th man: Shaheen Afridi trolled after expensive spell in ColomboT20 World Cup, IND vs PAK: Fast bowler Shaheen Shah Afridi was brutally trolled after his spell of 2-0-31-1 against India in the Group A clash on Sunday, February 15 at the R Premadasa Stadium in Colombo.

Devdutt Padikkal puts hands up for India Test No.3 with stunning Ranji semis centuryRanji Trophy 2025-26: Devdutt Padikkal scored 148 off 236 balls against Uttarakhand, guiding Karnataka to a commanding 355 for two at stumps on Day 1 at the Ekana Stadium in Lucknow.

Fearless Ishan Kishan decimates Pakistan's spin ploy, hits 40-ball 77 in ColomboT20 World Cup, India vs Pakistan: Ishan Kishan on Sunday credited his improved off-side play for his match-winning effort against arch-rivals Pakistan in the T20 World Cup. Kishan's 77 off 40 balls on a challenging surface proved decisive as India sealed a comfortable 61-run win.

Pakistan pull off Salman Agha masterstroke to dismiss Abhishek SharmaT20 World Cup, IND vs PAK: Salman Agha took the big wicket of Abhishek Sharma after opening the bowling for Pakistan in the marquee clash on Sunday at the R Premadasa Stadium in Colombo.

IND vs PAK Playing XIs: Abhishek Sharma returns for India, Arshdeep Singh benchedIndia vs Pakistan, T20 World Cup: The Men in Blue have made two changes to their side, with Abhishek Sharma returning to the side. In addition, India has gone with a spin-heavy bowling unit by bringing in Kuldeep Yadav instead of Arshdeep Singh.

Suryakumar Yadav avoids shaking hands with Pakistan captain at tossICC T20 World Cup, India vs Pakistan: India captain Suryakumar Yadav and Pakistan skipper Salman Ali Agha did not shake hands during the toss of their T20 World Cup 2026 clash in Colombo on Sunday, as India continued its no-handshake policy against Pakistan.

Sunday surge: India crush Australia to go 2-0 up before Pakistan clashINDW vs AUSW: Harmanpreet Kaur's India Women got off to a brilliant start in their series against Sophie Molineux's Australia, winning the first T20I by 21 runs (DLS) on Sunday at the Sydney Cricket Ground.

IND 1-0 PAK: Before T20 WC tie, India Women hammer Pakistan in Rising Stars Asia CupIndia Women A defeated Pakistan A by eight wickets in a Group A match of the Women's Asia Cup Rising Stars in Bangkok, with Dinesh Vrinda's unbeaten 55 guiding a dominant chase of 94.

WI vs NEP: Ruthless West Indies secure Super 8 spot, knock Nepal outT20 World Cup: A ruthless performance from the West Indies sees them become the first team to make it to the Super 8 stages of the T20 World Cup 2026 on Sunday, February 15. Shai Hope's fifty and Jason Holder's four-wicket haul ensured West Indies got the win and knocked out Nepal from the tournament.

No-handshake policy with Pak silly, India must play within spirit: ManjrekarFormer cricketer Sanjay Manjrekar has criticised India's no-handshake policy against Pakistan as silly and unbecoming of a major cricketing nation. The policy, in place since the Pahalgam attack, faces fresh scrutiny ahead of the T20 World Cup 2026 clash.

A Kohli-like innings will decide winner of India vs Pakistan: Ex-India playerIND vs PAK: Swashbuckling your way to a big total may not be the ideal approach at Colombo's R. Premadasa Stadium. Ahead of the marquee India vs Pakistan clash on February 15, former Bengal cricketer Shreevats Goswami said India might require a Virat Kohli-style innings — built on patience, strike rotation and calculated aggression — to come out on top.

Why India don't need Abhishek Sharma for Pakistan clashT20 World Cup: Abhishek Sharma's fitness has become the biggest subplot ahead of India vs Pakistan in Colombo. With the explosive opener back in training after illness, India must decide whether to risk him in cricket's marquee clash.

IND vs PAK: Boycott drama done, Mohsin Naqvi prepares Pakistan for India clashT20 World Cup: Ahead of the much-anticipated clash against India, Mohsin Naqvi met with the Pakistan team to motivate them for the T20 World Cup 2026 clash on Sunday, February 15 in Colombo.

Rohit Sharma joins Team India huddle in Colombo in special cameoT20 World Cup: Former India captain Rohit Sharma was in Colombo, joining the team huddle before the toss. Pakistan won the toss and opted to field at the R Premadasa Stadium on Sunday.

Nothing left to say? The struggle to write India vs Pakistan againT20 World Cup: India vs Pakistan returns in Colombo, but the rivalry feels heavier than ever. Beyond politics and hype, the real story is narrative exhaustion and cricket struggling to breathe.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
